sen.j: 西園寺 致季（さいおんじ むねすえ、天和 (日本)3年11月9日 (旧暦)（1683年12月26日） - 宝暦6年7月4日 (旧暦)（1756年7月30日））は、江戸時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Munesue SAIONJI (December 26, 1683 - July 30, 1756) was Kugyo (court noble) in the middle of the Edo period.
Munesue SAIONJI (December 26, 1683 - July 30, 1756) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: court noble→a Court Nobleに訂正しました。
sen.e: Munesue SAIONJI (December 26, 1683 - July 30, 1756) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 霊元天皇（112代）・東山天皇（113代）・中御門天皇（114代）・桜町天皇（115代）の四朝にわたって仕え、官位は従一位左大臣まで昇った。
sen.e: He serveed the Imperial Court for four reigns, Emperor Reigen (112th), Emperor Higashiyama (113th), Emperor Nakamikado (114th) and Emperor Sakuramachi (115th), and was raised to Juichii-sadaijin (Junior First Rank, minister of the left).

He served for the four sovereigns of the 112the Emperor Reigen, the 113th Emperor Higashiyama, the 114th Emperor Nakamikado and the 115th Emperor Sakuramachi; He was promoted up to "Juichii Sadaijin" (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Left).
sen.cmt: serveedスペルミスです。served the Imperial Court for the four reign,→served for the four sovereigns of ofに訂正しました。Raised to→ promoted up toに訂正しました。役職に""とandを追加しました。役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: He served for the four sovereigns of the 112the Emperor Reigen, the 113th Emperor Higashiyama, the 114th Emperor Nakamikado and the 115th Emperor Sakuramachi; He was promoted up to "Juichii Sadaijin" (Junior First Rank and Minister of the Left).

sen.j: 父は中納言西園寺実輔。
sen.e: His father was Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) Sanesuke SAIONJI.
His father was Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) Sanesuke SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: 役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: His father was Chunagon (Vice-Councilor of State) Sanesuke SAIONJI.
His mother was Ie no Nyobo (a lady-in-waiting).
His mother was "Ie no Nyobo" (Lady-in-Waiting).
sen.cmt: 役職に""を追加しました。役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: His mother was "Ie no Nyobo" (Lady-in-Waiting).

sen.j: 子に内大臣西園寺公晃、大納言飛鳥井雅香、権大納言小倉宣季、権大納言今出川誠季、大納言橋本実理、参議大宮貞季。
sen.e: His children were Naidaijin (minister of the center) Kinaki SAIONJI, Dainagon (chief councillor of state) Masaka ASUKAI, Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Nobusue OGURA, Gon Dainagon Nobusue IMADEGAWA, Dainagon Sanesuke HASHIMOTO, and Sangi (councillor) Sadasue OMIYA.

He had several children, including Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Kinaki SAIONJI, Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) Masaka ASUKAI, "Gon Dainagon" (Provisional Major Counselor) Nobusue OGURA, "Gon Dainagon" Nobusue IMADEGAWA, Dainagon Sanesuke HASHIMOTO, and Sangi (Councilor) Sadasue OMIYA.
sen.cmt: His children were→He had several children, includingに訂正しました。複数単語で連なる役職に""を追加しました。役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: He had several children, including Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) Kinaki SAIONJI, Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) Masaka ASUKAI, "Gon Dainagon" (Provisional Major Counselor) Nobusue OGURA, "Gon Dainagon" Nobusue IMADEGAWA, Dainagon Sanesuke HASHIMOTO, and Sangi (Councilor) Sadasue OMIYA.

sen.j: 貞享2年（1685年）に叙爵してから清華家として速いスピードで昇進した。
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1685, he was quickly promoted as the Seiga family (the second highest family status for court nobles).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1865, as a member of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period.
sen.cmt: was quickly promoted as the Seiga family→ as a member of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short periodに訂正しました。
sen.e: After he was conferred a peerage in 1865, as a member of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period.

sen.j: 侍従・近衛府・近衛府を経て、元禄9年（1696年）に従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: After he took the posts of Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff), Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1696 and was ranked with Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After he held the positions of Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) and Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1696, which gave him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: took the posts of→held the positions ofに訂正。was ranked with→which gave him the titleに訂正しました。
sen.e: After he held the positions of Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) and Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1696, which gave him the title Kugyo.

sen.j: 中納言・大納言・宝永3年（1706年）から宝永5年（1708年）にわたってと正徳 (日本)2年（1712年）から正徳3年（1713年）にわたっての二度にわたり神宮伝奏をつとめた。
sen.e: He served as Chunagon, Dainagon and also served as Jingutenso (shrine messenger to Emperor) twice from 1706 to 1708 and from 1712 to 1713.
He served as Jingutenso (Shrine Messenger to Emperor) twice; One was the period between 1706 and 1708 when he was Chunagon and Dainagon; Another was between 1712 and 1713.
He served as Jingutenso (Shrine Messenger to Emperor) twice; One was the period between 1706 and 1708 when he was Chunagon and Dainagon; Another was between 1712 and 1713.

sen.j: この間踏歌節会外弁をつとめる。
sen.e: During this time, he served as Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony)).
During these periods, he served as "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]).
sen.cmt: this time→these periodsに訂正しました。役職に""を追加しました。役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。（）内のカッコを[]に訂正しました。
sen.e: During these periods, he served as "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]).

sen.j: 享保9年（1724年）近衛府となる。
sen.e: In 1724, he became Knonoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
In 1724, he became Knonoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).
In 1724, he became Knonoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 享保13年（1728年）には内大臣となるも辞職した。
sen.e: Although he became Naidaijin (minister of the center) in 1728, he resigned the posts.
Although he became Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) in 1728, he resigned the position.
sen.cmt: 役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。Posts→positionに訂正しました。
sen.e: Although he became Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) in 1728, he resigned the position.

sen.j: 翌年従一位を授与された。
sen.e: Next year, he was conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
The next year, he was conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).
The next year, he was conferred Juichii (Junior First Rank).

sen.j: 元文3年（1738年）には右大臣となるも辞職。
sen.e: Although he became Udaijin (minister of the right) in 1738, he resigned the post.
Although he became Udaijin (Minister of the Right) in 1738, he resigned the position.
sen.cmt: 役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。post→positionに訂正しました。
sen.e: Although he became Udaijin (Minister of the Right) in 1738, he resigned the position.

sen.j: 延享2年（1745年）には左大臣となったが同年中に辞職している。
sen.e: He became Udaijin in 1745, however, he resigned the post within the same year.
He became Udaijin in 1745; Nevertheless, he resigned the position within the same year.
sen.cmt: and however→; Neverthelessに訂正しました。post→positionに訂正しました。
sen.e: He became Udaijin in 1745; Nevertheless, he resigned the position within the same year.
